voting.aboutVoting:
Voting

In the Polkadot OpenGov voting system, there are three types of votes:

  • Aye vote - a vote "for" a proposal. Votes are counted with a conviction multiplier that increases the number of votes based on the voter's conviction.
  • Nay vote - a vote "against." Similar to the aye vote, it considers the level of conviction, multiplying the number of votes.
  • Abstain vote - abstaining from voting. Abstain votes do not affect the conviction level and are not counted in the vote tally with conviction.
voting.aboutVotingPower:
Voting power and lock period

Conviction is a mechanism that allows participants to amplify their vote by locking their tokens for various periods (lock period). The longer the tokens are locked, the stronger the vote. For example, a six-times conviction increases the vote's weight and requires a token lock for 32 weeks after voting ends.
voting.title: Vote on

pureProxyTooltip.description1: A Pure Proxy is an account that you can create using one of your existing accounts. Pure Proxies can only carry out transactions when another account instructs it to. When you create a Pure Proxy the account that created it is automatically given the "Any" Delegated Authority access type meaning it can instruct the Pure Proxy to carry out any transaction, this can be changed once the Pure Proxy is created.
pureProxyTooltip.description2:
Pure Proxies provide additional account management features such as:
  • Enhanced Security: They cannot be stolen because they do not have a private key.
  • Simplified and Secure Account Management: Pure Proxies can help to simplify the management of complex account relationships
  • Multisig Account Management: Using a Pure Proxy makes it easier to change multisig signatories that can control your assets as a delegated authority.
pureProxyTooltip.title2: Why should I create a Pure Proxy?

proxy.tooltipPart1: Proxied wallets are wallet which have set one of your accounts in Nova Spektr as delegated authority (Proxies).
proxy.tooltipPart2: This means that you can control certain functions of these wallets based on the access type granted to you by the proxied wallet.

matrix.infoMatrixDescription: <matrix>Matrix</matrix> is an open source, secure, decentralised, real-time communication standard. The <smp>Spektr Matrix Protocol</smp> extension is built on Matrix and uses Matrix for:
matrix.infoMatrixDescriptionOne: Exchanging multisig account information amongst signatories.
matrix.infoMatrixDescriptionTwo: Exchanging multisig transaction events: initiation, signing, final signing, cancelling.
matrix.infoMatrixEncryption: Matrix provides state-of-the-art end-to-end-encryption. This ensures that only the intended recipients can ever decrypt your messages.
matrix.infoSpektrDescription: Nova Spektr uses Matrix to share multisig account information and multisig transaction information (including call data) with other signatories. Signing in to Matrix is the easiest way to share this information with your fellow signatories, as all the necessary information will be automatically shared.
matrix.infoWhyMatrixTitle: Why do I need to sign in with Matrix?

common.emptyProxyDescription: Add new proxies to work with them
common.proxyTooltipWhatIsProxy: A delegated authority is a type of account that acts as an intermediary or delegate for another account. Delegated authorities add an additional layer of control for your assets, allowing other accounts to control various operations for your account in a customizable way depending upon the access type.
common.proxyTooltipWhyProxy: Delegated authorities offer an additional layer of control. You can set explicit permissions and restrictions for another account to control certain operations relating to your assets. Delegated authorities allow you to distribute responsibilities more effectively.You are able to customize the type of access that delegated authorities have. For example you can allow another account to conduct only staking operations, only governance operations, or any operation on the network except for the transfer of assets.
common.proxyTooltipWhyProxyTitle: Why do I need to create delegated authorities (proxies)?
